WICKLIFFE ROSE
WILLIAM H. WELCH
-------
EDWIN R. EMBREE
SECRETARY
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
INTERNATIONAL HEALTH BOARD
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
October 2, 1918.
Dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
Dr. Guiteras has written advising that the
publication of his report on the yellow fever situa-
tion in Barbados would be helpful at this time.
General Gorgas concurred in the suggestion. On look-
ing up the report we find that it refers to a large
number of case record charts. We are unable to locate
these charts in our files. General Gorgas is now
abroad and his office advises that they are not in
position to locate them in his absence. It occurs to
me that you read the report and perhaps you may have
some recollection of these charts. I should be glad
to know if you saw them, and if so, if you returned
them to General Gorgas.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Wickliffe Rose. Dr. H. R. Carter,
Baltimore, Maryland.
